general.headline: CTO / EVP Research & Development
general.mutualConnectionsText: Hamilton Mann, Ben Costantini, and 311 other mutual connections
general.description:
Leveraging my broad academic and industrial international experience, I love to bring Innovation and Impact through science and technology, from lab to plant and market. I partner with business leaders to foster an innovation open to the outside (customers, suppliers, start-ups, academia ..) where customer obsession and strategic partnerships are key pillars.
I stimulate the worldwide R&D organization with a strong emphasis on collaboration, openness, diversity, and talent development to deliver a sustained performance.

I am a strong believer that the environmental situation that we collectively face results in both fantastic challenges and exciting opportunities for R&D, requiring us to foster and combine the energies from all worlds (academia, start-ups and SMEs, large corporations, investors, governments) across traditional value chains and market silos. My personal experience convinced me that partnerships are a key vector to Transform and Innovate at the proper pace.

On a personal side I am energized by great science, business strategy, working in multicultural and international environments, building value partnerships by proper consideration of each parties interest, teamworking with bright people, and coaching people in their own work and development.

general.headline: CTO
general.mutualConnectionsText: Yann Lechelle, Yann Sarfati, and 137 other mutual connections
general.description:
Iâ€™m passionate with technologies: for what they are and moreover for what they enable.

Iâ€™ve built my professional carrier on that basis: to study and analyze new technologies and engage them into tools, platforms, R&D prototypes, all of them meeting the company business activity and strategy.

Thus, my role and responsibility eventually advanced to building and managing technical teams, constituted of developers, project managers, QA testers, system and database administrators and product owners.

As a CTO, I'm also part of the senior executive team actively participating to defining the business strategy and aligning the technical strategy accordingly.

Thanks to my professional experiences, I'm fully qualified to actively participate to defining and applying a company's strategy. By recruiting the right talents, motivating them with proper objectives and relevant work processes, I contribute to the company's success having efficient teams, providing highly reliable platforms and developing a strong sense of communication and cross teams collaboration.

Technology team manager for Phonevalley, the mobile advertisement company of Publicis Group

Phonevalley accompanies Publicisâ€™ clients in defining their communication (advertisement) strategy through mobile channels (messaging, sites, webapps and applications). Publics Group acquired the company in 2007: we centralize the mobile skills for the group, especially for the European and US markets.
As the CTO of Phonevalley, I manage the technological skillset of the companyâ€™s technical department. Competencies are organized into 3 distinct units: platforms (development, maintenance and running proprietary platforms), services (clientsâ€™ mobile projects production) and support (technological partnerships management and system administration).

Technology Director:
â€¢	Define the technological strategy of the company (production organization, proprietary platforms, R&D orientations)

â€¢	Technology watch

â€¢	R&D: analysis, reports, financial helps
See above

Management of Phonevalley technical team in charge of handling all mobile Internet projects (WAP-based technologies, iMode, etc.)

Two different roles:
 1/ Team manager: hire, train and manage the technical team (up to 7 project managers and developers)
 2/ Strategy development: identify technical requirements to cope with agency's and clients' expectations; oversee proprietary platforms development (rendering engine and mobile Internet site development tool)

Management of the technical team responsible for developing a geo-localized MMORPG

NewtGames was born with the second Japanese mobile operator (KDDI) new massive offer of GPS-enabled cell phones. The business model of this French startup was to leverage this geo-localization capability to bring Massively-Multi Users Role Playing Game to the streets and allow users to play the game while moving their avatars in the real world.

My role was to manage the technical team (developers, graphic artists, WEB developers) in order to build a game engine flexible enough to implement several kind of geo-localized MMORPG (different game designs, different game backgrounds, etc.) I have realized the server-side software architecture, written technical specifications and participated to the development (especially to the development of a Geographic Information System for the specific purpose of the game). More precisely:
    â€¢	I hired and managed the technical team (up to 6 people)
    â€¢	I wrote the technical specifications (software architecture, environment, etc.) of the MMORPG game engine
    â€¢	I wrote the technical specifications (software architecture, environment, etc.) of a GIS (Geographic Information System), based on several algorithms: Dijkstra, Cohen-Sutherland  â€“ this GIS has been used for a Nike and SFR (French operator) advertisement program against racism
    â€¢	Iâ€™ve initiated and participated to R&D effort
I have also lead the effort of submitting a request for financial help from the French government to support innovative companies. The name of the program is ANVAR and NewtGames has been approved to participate to this program to achieve its innovative developments.

A game (named Mogii) has been successfully deployed in Japan in April 2003. It was live until end of 2006.

Analysis, architecture and development of an interactive system including a Video-On-Demand platform

My main role in this company was to build an interactive platform which purpose was to be deployed aboard cruise ships.
I have analyzed the needs, provided relevant software architecture for the platform (using CORBA distributed architecture, SNMP for network fault management and a 3rd party Video-On-Demand platform called NCube) and participated to the platform development and deployment.
The platform has been successfully deployed into 60 crew member cabins for a first live test when I still was working for the company.
I have also participated to several IT system administration tasks, including managing file servers, application servers and accounting platform.
I have left the company at the end of the internship, called CoopÃ©ration au Service Militaire en Entreprise, which is an opportunity for French masterâ€™s degree graduates to work for a subsidiary of a French enterprise in a foreign country in place of the compulsory military duty.

Business, technological and managerial issues must be reconciled
- Audit: understand, discover and analyze the context -> return to the use of the project
- Advice: drive improvement, priorities, governance, tools, organization -> the heart of the matter
- Coaching: develop, raise awareness, enrich skills -> perpetuate this organization

general.headline: CEO & CTO at Actility
general.mutualConnectionsText: Jeremy Guillo, Olivier Mathiot, and 1,024 other mutual connections
general.description:
"Getting things to work (better)" is a passion that started early repairing toys and building electronic circuits, and continued through my professional life working on communication technologies, with a focus on IP based networks.
With the startup experience as founder of NetCentrex , I discovered that 'getting people to build something together' was even more rewarding... and more challenging.
Any project which aims at improving the way we live or work, supported by hard working, ambitious, crazy (not too much), fun and caring people will make me want to be part of it. I invest in several start-ups and also my own projects. I also support the Non-Profit organization "Socracy", which tries to bring some of the innovations of social networks to the world of politics (that's perhaps a bit too crazy !).

Specialties: * Smart grids (flexibility management), Electric Vehicles.
* M2M (Cellular, low power RF short and long range, ETSI M2M, OneM2M)
* VoIP systems (Softswitch, Voice and Video Media servers and their applications for announcements, voicemail, lawful interception, Session Border Controllers, NAT traversal...) used for transit or residential/IP based Centrex or trunking solutions.
Value Added Services for mobile networks (SMS/MMS, IM, Ringback tones...).
Back-end systems for telecommunication services, activation, provisioning, rating and charging.

jobs.description: Actility is the world leader of Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN)  infrastructure and service platforms. ThingPark Wireless is powering national LPWAN deployments of telecom operators and large enterprises worldwide. ThingPark marketplace provides a platform for developers, device and application vendors to expose their IoT solutions on global markets. Actility is a founder member of the LoRa alliance.

OH Development offers consultancy services for IT and telecommunications companies, especially related to the deployment and activation of VoIP related services. It also has a research, development and investment activity in the fields of renewable energy (offshore windfarms), trading models, and innovation models based on a combination of Wiki & Social networks concepts.

Socracy is a non-profit organization aiming at facilitating the generation of new political ideas and proposals through greater and simpler implication of field experts, and organizing the confrontation of such proposals in order to promote the emergence of consensus.
Socracy is open to both individuals and thinktanks or political organizations, who are free to use the Socracy.org collaboration engine. Socracy.org uses an advanced form of Wiki engine based on XWiki, complemented by custom development for group and annotation management. The site is currently under development and will open in January 2009.
Membership is free for full access. Active membership status is 50â‚¬/year. Permanent Benefactor status for all donations in excess of 2500â‚¬ (this status is permanent).

Responsible for CTO group (Intellectual property management, Innovation scouting & prototyping, advanced demos in trade shows, harmonization of technology roadmaps, architecture & development methodology of Comverse lines of business). CxO level customer facing role for Comverse technology.

I founded NetCentrex with B. Jannes in 1999, then managed its expansion through 3 rounds of financing which allowed NCX to address the US and EMEA markets through local subsidiaries, and acquire MG2 Technologies in 2000. After 2002 I focused mainly on technology management (CTO) and customer facing activities, remaining President while T. Martin Martin, founder of MG2, became CEO.
In 2006 Comverse acquired NetCentrex. NCX had become a recognized leader in residential VoIP with over 6M end-users (2006) and the largest deployment worldwide. The company was also very strong in corporate services (trunking, IPCentrex(r), VPN) with the largest deployments worldwide (over 30000 sites). NetCentrex also had a strong audio/video media server offering for both VoIP/IMS and TDM/IN networks (over 100,000 ports deployed directly & through OEM agreements).
In 2006, NetCentrex had over 400 employees and was highly profitable with a revenue exceeding 50Mâ‚¬.

Various research & expertise topics:
- Firewall security audits & recommendations for the group
- IP Routing and multicast protocols & architectures
- IP QoS
- Voice over IP, responsible for the TULIP project investigating VoIP offerings and architectures for France Telecom and Deutsche Telekom. This project lead to the Spin-off of Netcentrex, together with lead engineer Bernard Jannes.

Design and programming for Sortirama. Sortirama was the first entertainment booking system available in France on the Web, targeting maintly theaters, museums and exhibitions and accepting credit card payments online. The website was awarded the Microsoft/Essentiel du management "Master du Web" award for 1998-1999 and remained active until 2003. It was shut down in 2003, outpowered by the new online systems of the major ticket resellers.

general.description:
Passionate about Science and Technologies, I have spent most of my careerÂ in STEM fields. I am very much motivated by finding applicationsÂ of technologies to solve important and interesting problems. So currently I have Co-founded SAMP, which is a SAS platform to have a 3D Shared Reality for heavy industrial plants. The main value proposition is to build the data backbone which is coherent with the actual industrial site. 

Along with my Co-founder Laurent, ourÂ personal mission for this venture is to solve the day-to-day problem of heavy industries by providing them a tools to become more Digital, Safe and ClimateÂ friendly. 

Also using this opportunity to build an environment for Researchers and Engineers to build technologiesÂ that are at the edge of scientific research. At SAMP we do deep research in the fields of 3D Point clouds, Graph mapping, 3D rendering and Computational Geometry.

often I spend my time studying and discussing AI, Entrepreneurship, Climate, Science, Philosophy and Finance. Lets connect! :)

Email: shivani@samp.ai

jobs.description:
Large industrial facilities are constantly being maintained and modernized by many players in order to keep them safe and efficient while dramatically decreasing their environmental footprint. However, the owners of such facilities are struggling to keep up. At the source of most issues is the lack of a clear and up-to-date knowledge of the state of the facility.

Samp automates the creation and update of intelligent 3D model of your plant, starting from the only reliable source of information: the field. Our solution turns simple laser scans into a proper "Digital Twin" and exposes it to all players involved so it becomes a technical hub where all work is planned and executed based on facts, not assumptions.

Thesis Subject :
Machine Learning using Graphs for very large Metagenomic datasets
Key Research Areas : Machine Learning, Graphs, Big Data, Clustering, Visualization, Metagenomics 

In this thesis, we perform exploratory study on the methods for Binning of large Metagenomics datasets. The process of binning is essentially clustering of genomic reads, which poses a challange of time-space complexity. In this thesis we propose an approach to capture the neighbourhood information of the data using various proximity graphs and identify clusters using community detection algorithms. The experiments have been conducted on various Metagenomic datasets and appropriate methods have been proposed based on observation.

The Master thesis was conducted in collaboration with CEA Grenoble.
Thesis advisor: Renaud Blanc

In this internship we focused on developing Interactive Visualisation for highlighting structural similarities between Protine and Peptides. The tool was developed in JAVA to be a Plugin to an exisiting Bioinformatics software.

This internship was hosted by the World Wide Web consortium office in Delhi and IT Department of Goverment of India. During this internship we worked on developing New standard for Mobile web browsers and studied their support for Complex fonts of Indian languages. The study included benchmarking CSS and Javascript features for on various handheld devices, specifically for Indian fonts.

publications.title: Start-up Flow - Get Your Team Up and Running As Quickly As Possible
publications.description: So you've got that big idea, and hopefully even one or more cofounders and you're just about to get things done. But then you hit a wall, actually a few walls, one by one... How are you going to communicate ? How do you keep a knowledge base ? How do you setup your workflow, environments, etc. All the right information is available online, only it is fragmented in a bajillion places like Quora, Stack Exchange, or worse: blogs. That's why we decided to write this book after spending a few weeks reading up on every resource available for each topic, trying and arbitraging between some of the solutions described. It is an opinionated guide in the sense that it is of course not the only solution. We tried to strike the perfect balance between learning curve, reusable skills, money spent, and time used.
